EXPERIENCE.BABEL_DESCRIPTION: I collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams, promoting clear and efficient communication that optimizes development timelines and overall quality. Initially, my work focused on building a promotional landing page, emphasizing cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, and high fidelity to the prototypes delivered by the UX/UI team. Currently, I contribute to the evolution and continuous improvement of a back-office application, implementing advanced UI components with PrimeNG and streamlining the styling process using Tailwind CSS. I work under the Scrum methodology with weekly sprints, ensuring frequent and effective deliveries that are continuously reviewed by the operations team for feedback and iterative improvement.
EXPERIENCE.CIP_DESCRIPTION: We all start somewhere, and in my case, it was as an English teacher. Looking to earn income while continuing my studies, I began working at a school near my home. As an instructor, my main responsibility was to plan, develop, and explain each topic to groups of students with very different learning profiles, applying the CIP method and reinforcing their progress through exercises and conversation sessions. The school had a strong culture of continuous feedback, which allowed me to receive valuable input to improve my performance and adapt my teaching strategies for better student outcomes. The groups I worked with were highly diverse: children, adults over 40, small personalized groups of 2 to 3 people, and larger groups of up to 15 students. This job helped me develop strong patience, frustration tolerance, and assertive communication skills, along with the ability to find varied solutions. I learned that every student progresses differently and at their own pace, and as a teacher, my role was to identify the best approach to achieve meaningful learning within the time each student invested.
EXPERIENCE.NETLOGISTIK_DESCRIPTION: As a Software Developer, I actively contributed to the implementation of customized features for multiple clients within a multitenant TMS system. I collaborated with a multidisciplinary team following the Scrum methodology with three-week sprints, ensuring consistent and high-quality deliveries. I was involved in every stage of the process, including requirements analysis, prototype design, planning, development, deployment, and testing for each feature. Although my role was not exclusively focused on front-end development, I created highly responsive interfaces while maintaining strict fidelity to the provided visual designs. Additionally, I was responsible for building Express.js endpoints needed to support various system functionalities. I also led the refactoring of legacy modules that did not meet established code quality metrics, achieving significant improvements in the product's efficiency, maintainability, and overall performance.
